verse: These are the words of Amos, one of the shepherds from the town of Tekoa [a small town in the highlands of Judah, ten miles south of Jerusalem]. ·He saw this vision about […which he saw concerning] Israel two years before the earthquake [Zech. 14:5]. ·It was at the time […in the days when] Uzziah was king of Judah [ruled 769–733 bc] and Jeroboam son of Jehoash was king of Israel [ruled 800–784 bc].
